item.title: Deploy a Hugo website using Github Actions on Github Pages
item.description: Introduction In this guide, I’m going to explain how I’m deploying this website to Github Pages with couple of git commit (and followed by git push of course). Links will be provided to the other guides I used for reference as we go along the process. The choice for Hugo as a static site generator is mainly because: It is very quick to build. The ability to use markdown syntax to create your pages is nice.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: Who? Hi there! I’m a systems engineer from the Maldives. Majority of my work is on design and implementing IT infrastructure and managing Ops of a small IT team. But lately I’ve been really automation, config management, cloud services and little bit of development. You can find more details on what I do at LinkedIn or say hello on Twitter Why? A bit of a background story. I always tend to research a lot and see what others are doing before I try to implement something; whether its a new technology, new practice etc.
